categories.title: Recent Pull Requests in the elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
Several pull requests have been submitted to the elizaOS/eliza repository recently:

1. Documentation improvements: PR #4366 by samihao11 clarifies the paths for framework users versus core contributors.

2. New functionality: PR #3894 by mindxploit adds permanent knowledge capability to the system.

3. Bug fixes: 
   - PR #3890 by daniel-trevino fixes loading character plugins from remote URLs
   - PR #4367 by PixelPil0t1 corrects a broken Pump.fun link
   - PR #4369 by Vid201 adds default project text to the create CLI

4. Development improvements: PR #4370 by ai16z-demirix adds test coverage and setup for the Anthropic plugin.

The crypto market shows price fluctuations for major cryptocurrencies. WETH (Wrapped Ethereum) has increased from $1,786.73 to $1,821.64, representing a gain of approximately 1.95%. Meanwhile, SOL (Solana) has decreased from $150.94 to $149.24, showing a slight decline of about 1.13%.

categories.title: Auto.fun and its Relationship with ai16z and degenai

content.text: Auto.fun was well planned and executed, creating an ai16z liquidity pool through buy fees for tokens launched on the platform. This arrangement benefits degenai in the long term, as ai16z will drive buybacks for degenai. Following the successful pump.fun launch, there is excitement about the elizaos team's upcoming developments, specifically v2 of degenai and Eliza OS.

The Discord conversation discusses the implementation of visemes (mouth shapes for speech) in a character animation system. Godfreyart reported successfully getting a show to step through JSON data and load audio with visemes, but noted that artists need to fix the viseme order and schema for each character for proper implementation.

Godfreyart shared specific requirements for morphtargets/blendkeys, indicating that the first 15 positions should follow a default pattern for speech animation. While characters can have additional blendkeys for expressions like blinking and emotions, the first 15 must follow this standard structure.

There was also discussion about platform migration, with a question about whether to remove the Unity version of 'Clanktank' since the project appears to be moving to PlayCanvas. Smsithlord recommended keeping a backup of the Unity version as a precaution, noting uncertainty about plans for maintaining the same shows across multiple platforms.

Over the past two days (April 26-28, 2025), the elizaos/eliza repository has shown consistent activity with 4 new pull requests opened, though none were merged during this period. There was 1 new issue created on April 26-27, with no new issues the following day. The project maintained active contributor engagement, with 6 contributors active during April 26-27, decreasing to 3 active contributors during April 27-28.
sources: From 2025-04-26 to 2025-04-27, elizaos/eliza had 2 new PRs (0 merged), 1 new issues, and 6 active contributors.
From 2025-04-27 to 2025-04-28, elizaos/eliza had 2 new PRs (0 merged), 0 new issues, and 3 active contributors.

content.text: The provided sources mention 'Top contributors for elizaOS/eliza' but do not provide any specific details about who these contributors are or their contributions to the project. Without additional information, it's not possible to generate a detailed summary of the top contributors to the elizaOS/eliza repository.

categories.title: Issue #4368: What is required in token swap using evm plugin?

content.text: GitHub issue #4368 was opened by user 0xopsdev regarding requirements for token swaps using the EVM plugin in the elizaOS/eliza repository. The specific details of the issue would require viewing the full content on GitHub.

## Auto.fun Platform

Auto.fun is a recently launched token launchpad (less than a week old) that has been open-sourced by the ElizaOS team. The platform has generated mixed reactions from community members, with some expressing concerns about its similarity to pump.fun and questioning its long-term utility. The platform reportedly generated around $2k in fees during a single day.

A significant issue occurred with a token called Quill during migration, where a bug incorrectly represented the token-to-SOL ratio, allowing someone to drain the liquidity pool by selling at a premium. The team clarified it wasn't an exploit but a bug, deployed a fix, and promised refunds to affected users in SOL.

Other reported issues included tokens not showing up after creation, black screens during token launch attempts, and tokens being stuck in migration for extended periods (12-20 hours).

## ElizaOS Development

The team is working on Eliza v2 alongside auto.fun development. The project follows an open-source approach, inviting developer contributions rather than adhering to strict roadmaps. As osintmao9 mentioned, "They don't really operate on roadmaps or deadlines. They just code. A lot."

There are ongoing discussions about a potential token migration from "ai16z" to "ElizaOS" due to frustrations with a platform developer named Bao/baoskee. Community members debate the mechanics and implications of a token swap, with concerns about liquidity, exchange coordination, and potential market impact.

The official contract addresses were shared:
- ai16z: HeLp6NuQkmYB4pYWo2zYs22mESHXPQYzXbB8n4V98jwC
- degenai: Gu3LDkn7Vx3bmCzLafYNKcDxv2mH7YN44NJZFXnypump

## AI Agent Development

Several discussions centered on the current lack of revenue-generating AI agents in the ecosystem, with most existing agents focused on entertainment or alpha rather than practical utility. As one user noted, "revenue generating agents are not there" and "alpha agents like aixbt etc are only there."

There's interest in developing an "eli5" bot with specific personality traits, described as a "terminally online tiktok rich 14 year old that keeps skipping grades and thinks hes hot shit."

A developer mentioned working on a Livepeer plugin for v2 that offers "free incentivized inference" and was seeking review. The plugin development and review process for ElizaOS v2 was also discussed, though without clear answers provided.

## Technical Implementations

A brief discussion about character animation implementation revealed work on a system using JSON and visemes (mouth shapes for speech). A developer reported successfully getting a show to step through JSON data and load audio with visemes, but noted that artists need to fix the viseme order and schema for each character.

There was also a question about whether to keep or remove the Unity version of "Clanktank" since the project appears to be moving to PlayCanvas. The recommendation was to keep a backup of the Unity version as a precaution.

## Community Management

A moderation incident occurred where a community member (DorianD) was temporarily kicked from the server, which was later reversed. A team member explained that "a community contributor who has moderation access" had kicked the user after being inactive for 9 days.

There were suggestions for improving Discord moderation with proper role hierarchies and bot integration. One user recommended using Wick or Dyno bots with a supermod team structure to prevent abuse of powers.

Some members requested separate partner channels for serious and non-serious discussions, and there was interest in highlighting Clank Tank winners on Auto.fun with voting for weekly winners.
